org.apache.cocoon.transformation

Class ResponseHeaderTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractTransformer
      • org.apache.cocoon.transformation.ResponseHeaderTransformer

  • public class ResponseHeaderTransformer
extends AbstractTransformer
    Set HTTP response headers from an XML document. Declaration in sitemap: 
      <map:transformers default="xslt">
    <map:transformer name="response-headers" src="org.apache.cocoon.transformation.ResponseHeaderTransformer"/>
  </map:transformers>
    Usage in pipeline: 
      <map:transform type="response-headers"/>
    It will look for elements in the "http://apache.org/cocoon/responseHeader/1.0" namespace. The following elements are recognized (assuming xmlns:header="http://apache.org/cocoon/responseHeader/1.0"):
    <header:set name="Xyz" value="some value"/>
    Sets the header "Xyz" to "some value"
    <header:set-status code="nnn"/>
    Sets the HTTP status of the response.
    <header:set-error code="nnn" message="some error description"/>
    Sets the HTTP status code to "nnn" and the status message to the value of the message attribute. 'nnn' should be an integer HTTP status code. Only applicable for HTTP responses and ignored for other response types. Put this tag after other header:-tags otherwise the other tags will be ignored!
